entry.title: BKP - Customer Returns Project Solution for Advanced Intercompany Sales
entry.content:
Context

Since year 2022, advanced intercompany sales (Single Level / Single System), using scope item 5D2, is available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition. It is a better solution compared with the classical intercompany sales solution.

Advanced Intercompany Sales - Single Level / Single System

For more details, read the blog:

Advanced Intercompany Sales & Stock Transfer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Below is an example of the solution process flow for 5D2 in value chain monitor, starting with sales order 17729.

Nowadays, there is no standard, corresponding customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales.

In your project, you will need to identify an appropriate customer returns solution for advanced intercompany sales (5D2).

In this blog, several project solutions are proposed for managing returns of advanced intercompany sales, you can select the most suitable one based on your business needs.

 

Solution Option 1: 2F4 Classical intercompany returns  

In general, the classical intercompany returns process is a simplified, out of box solution.

Classic Intercompany Returns - Single Level / Single System

Below is the classical intercompany returns solution process flow with reference to sales order 17729. This is available in returns overview at item level in manage customer returns version 2 App.

Step by step guidelines are available in scope item 2F4 .

 The Solution option 1 includes the following highlights:

  • For selling company and delivering company – there is no need for an explicit customer/supplier relationship.
  • Returned Product is physically shipped back to delivering company’s plant directly.

However, there are some special restriction or limitation to consider with this option

  • Important: Technically, if you have activated scope item 5W2 (Group Valuation), the system will not allow you to activate classic intercompany processes - including this scope item 2F4.  Check more in KBA 3093830 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud: Release Restriction Note for Group Valuation. 
  • As this is the classical solution, the new concept or innovation in 5D2 are not available in 2F4.
    • No returns purchase order, and no supplier credit memo in selling company, and no intercompany returns order in delivering company.
    • No transit plant concept in selling company in such classical intercompany returns.
  • Additionally, the classical intercompany returns, whether used for classical intercompany sales or advance intercompany sales, have specific by-design features and limitations:
    • During goods receipt, returned product is automatically valuated in receiving company and the sales cost is reversed. This is by design.
    • If there is a material inspection split for returns delivery item, intercompany credit memo process is not supported at this time.

 

Solution Option 2: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity (LFU) 0007 – Directly ship to supplier

In general, the option 2 is a customized and simplified solution.

In this solution option, basically, for intercompany returns end to end process, we split the returns process for selling companying and delivering company. Each company runs BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0007 “directly ship to supplier” in the selling company.  This solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • Like outbound shipment from delivering plant in sales process, in this return’s scenario, product is returned to delivering plant (delivering company) directly.
  • Enhanced document flow - returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles the returns from the end customer as follows:

  1. Create a returns order with reference, using logistical follow-up activity 0007 “direct ship to supplier”. Use the business partner (BP) of the delivery company code as supplier, not the delivery plant. Select the right return-to address from the supplier. Change the plant to the plant of selling company, instead of the copied intercompany plant.
  2. No returns delivery to the selling company – the customer sends the goods to delivery company directly.
  3. A returns purchase order for the delivering company is created following step 1.
  4. Receive a credit memo from the delivering company and perform supplier credit memo verification.
  5. Determine refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles (internal) customer returns from selling company as follows:

  1. Create a returns order to handle (intercompany) customer returns from the selling company.
  2. The returns delivery is created, and post goods receipt once the end customer ships back the product.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up as usual.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer – selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaways to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in the selling company
    • Intercompany plant can’t be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company. Transit plant designed in 5D2 might be used.
    • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. The BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported. Ensure you select the right return-to address based on the supplier.
  • Returns Purchase Order (RPO) in the selling company
    • It would be automatically created with LFU 0007. RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the purchase order (PO) from sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in the selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in the delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use the BP of selling company as the sold-to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as the product by default not being valuated during goods receipt.

 

Solution Option 3: BKP Customer Returns - Using Logistical Follow-Up Activity 0005 – Ship to supplier

In general, option 3 is a customized solution, and you can adopt it if it matches your real returns process.

In this solution option, basically, for the intercompany returns end-to-end process, we split the returns process for the selling companying and delivering company. Each company run BKP (customer returns) separately. We utilize the predefined logistical follow-up activity 0005 “ship to supplier” in the selling company. his solution option has the following highlights:

  • We establish an internal customer (selling company) and internal supplier (delivering company) relationship - Treating delivering company as the supplier for selling company. 
  • in this return’s scenario, the product is returned to the selling company plant first and then returned to the delivering plant (delivering company) as 2nd step.
  • Enhanced document flow – a returns purchase order and supplier credit memo in the selling company, and intercompany returns order in delivering company are created.
  • Inventory, sales cost and revenue can be reversed with regular finance accounting in the two companies.

Selling company handles returns from the end customer as follows

  1. Create a returns order, using logistical follow-up activity (LFU) 0001- receive into plant. Use the plant of the selling company.  
  2. Returns delivery is auto created, and post goods receipt once you receive the returned product from the customer. 
  3. Perform material inspection, using LFU 0005 – ship to supplier – treating delivery company as the supplier (here use the BP number of delivery company code as supplier).
  4. Returns purchase order is created in above step 3. Perform the outbound delivery to ship the returned product to delivery company.
  5. Receive the intercompany credit memo from the delivery company and perform credit memo verification.
  6. Determine the refund for the end customer with credit memo request and credit memo.

Delivering company handles intercompany customer returns from selling company as follows

  1. Create a returns order to handle the intercompany customer returns from the selling company.
  2. Returns delivery is created post goods receipt when you receive the returned product from the selling company.
  3. Perform product inspection and decide the final logistical follow-up activity.
  4. Determine the refund for the internal customer – selling company with credit memo request and credit memo.

There are some special restrictions or takeaway to consider for this option

  • Returns order creation in selling company
    • Intercompany plant can’t be used if it is copied from sales order. Use the plant belonging to the selling company for the physical receiving of the returned product.
  • Material Inspection in selling company
    • Use logistical follow up activity 0005 “ship to supplier” to forward the returned product to the delivery company. Use the BP of the delivery company code as the supplier. BP of the delivering plant is currently not supported.  RPO might encounter the account assignment category issue as it is created with reference to the PO from the sales process. Today, expert configuration can be considered for RPO creation without reference.
  • Supplier Credit Memo in selling company
    • Manual creation is required. With B2B/EDI between the selling company and delivering company, automation is possible.
  • Intercompany returns order in delivering company
    • It can only be created without reference.
    • Use BP of selling company as the sold -to party.
  • Other processes in delivering company are performed as usual, such as product by default not being evaluated during goods receipt.

 

Master Data Set Up for Option 2 and 3

For Solution Option 2 and Option 3, there are below tips to highlight

  • Use the BP of delivery company code as the supplier. Do not use the BP of the delivering plant.
  • For supplier master data
    • Ensure the returns supplier is selected. With selection, you must assign a customer (same partner with customer role) to deal with the outbound shipping for returns purchase order.

 

  • You might maintain the right return–to address for the supplier if option 2 is used.  Check the help document Return-to Address Determination for Supplier Returns
  •  Ensure you have the right info record maintained for the returns purchase order.

 

Summary

3 solution options in project for intercompany returns to deal with advanced intercompany sales are recommended.

You can adopt the suitable one in your project, considering the restrictions and takeaways in each solution.

entry.title: Re: BOM Component Validation
entry.content: method IF_EX_BOM_UPDATE~CHANGE_AT_SAVE. DATA: lv_has_duplicates TYPE c LENGTH 1 VALUE ' ', lt_unique TYPE HASHED TABLE OF stpob WITH UNIQUE KEY idnrk, wa TYPE stpob. DATA lt_filtered TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF stasb. LOOP AT delta_stpob INTO wa. READ TABLE lt_unique WITH KEY idnrk = wa-idnrk TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS. IF sy-subrc = 0. " Duplicate found lv_has_duplicates = 'X'. EXIT. ELSE. INSERT wa INTO TABLE lt_unique. ENDIF. ENDLOOP. IF lv_has_duplicates = 'X'. MESSAGE e000(zbom) WITH wa-idnrk. " Custom message: duplicate component ENDIF. this logic not working in cs02, sir

--batch_34fcd829-64e4-4139-b880-f24aa4ee9235
Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=changeset_5e8e492f-2e3f-490f-9629-a4cd82a7aafd

"ParameterKey" : "Env"
"ParameterValue" : "Dev002",
"DataType" : "xsd:string"

Any suggestion on what I am doing wrong?

Thanks, 
Lakshmi

entry.title: 在阿根延，销售发票的代扣代缴税如何实现
entry.content:
我们在阿根延SAP S4 public cloud项目中，有销售发票(sale billing)想实现对客户的代收代缴。

生成的会计凭证如下：

借：应收金额  122  ARS ，

贷：收入 100  ARS，

贷：增值税 21  ARS（21%的税率），

贷：代收代缴税  1   ARS(1%的税率) 。

请问我在销售发票定价程序中，要使用哪个条件类型实现代收代缴税1%。

entry.title: Re: How to avoid FX distortions in production order varia...
entry.content: Hi @mpavan_kumar, I understand that the architecture of Public Cloud is a single Controlling Area, I'm interested in what strategies companies use to isolated the FX impact for a global manufacturing company. For example, if a US based company has a subsidiary in Australia, internal activities in Australia will be allocated on the basis of USD. The local cost inputs in AUD may be stable, but reporting would show significant price variances due to FX fluctuation. How does S/4HANA Public Cloud mitigate the potential distortion of production order variances caused by foreign exchange effects, given that activity prices are valued in the controlling area currency? Is there a recommended approach (e.g. use of additional currency types in ACDOCA, parallel valuation methods, or reporting layers) to ensure that local production managers can analyse variances in their own local currency without exchange rate noise? Are there roadmap items to enable more direct maintenance or derivation of activity prices in local currency while retaining the global benefits of a single controlling area?

entry.title: Re: How to combine two vendor's business volume and split...
entry.content:
Hi Michael
Thanks for your update
unfortunately, looks system will default make the rebate settlement to the vendor at the head level of condition contract.
In SPRO, define “split rules” for settlement documents and include fields from the business volume (e.g., vendor/brand/material group) as split criteria. The system will create multiple settlement documents accordingly, but all documents will still use the contract header partner.

I even tried to create the vendor hierarchy(one top node and two sub node), and put the top node vendor to the contract head level, two sub node vendor maintained in business volume, however, system will try to make the settlement to top vendor at the contract head

entry.title: Re: Need to directly scrap the return stock in one -step
entry.content:
Dear @Mohammed_Abbasraja,

Kindly, confirm whether this is a sales return process or not

In Case of sales return process use the Advanced Returns management (Document type RE2) and Using the below options while saving the Return Order in VA01
Material Received = True
Follow up activity = "003" Immediately move to scarp.
This will move the return item to Scrap immediately after saving the return order.


Hope this helps!!!

Best Regards,
Surya.

entry.title: The Internal Party Flag in SAP Sales Cloud V2
entry.content:
If you’ve ever worked on a sales quote in an integrated setup, you’ve probably faced this situation:

  • You add your Pre-Sales Consultant or Approval Manager as a party in the quote.
  • You replicate the quote to S/4HANA, and suddenly, the backend system is confused. “Who is this role? Where do I map it? Why is it here?”

This is a common pain. Sales reps often work with roles that are important internally but have no relevance in ERP. That’s where the Internal Party Flag comes in.

Why We Needed This

Sales reps don’t just work with customers,  they collaborate with internal specialists, consultants, and managers who help shape a deal that the  backend ERP systems may not care about 

How do we let sales teams add internal-only roles to quotes without cluttering ERP or risking overwrites from backend replication?

The Objective

To give sales reps flexibility and control, SAP Sales Cloud V2 now allows certain party roles to be flagged as internal-only.

  • These roles live purely in Sales Cloud.

  • They don’t flow into S/4HANA or other backend systems.

  • And they’re protected from being overwritten by inbound ERP updates.

It’s a simple checkbox, but it solves a big problem.

Two Common Use Cases

1. Internal-Only Roles
Picture a rep assigning a Pre-Sales Consultant to a quote. This person is critical for internal reviews within the CRM but irrelevant to ERP. By marking the role as internal, it stays inside Sales Cloud, excluded from the integration payload.

2. Prevent External Overwrites
Let’s say S/4HANA tries to update the quote with its own payload. If that payload includes an internal role, Sales Cloud ignores it. The internal data stays intact.

By turning on the Internal Party Flag, they separated the two worlds:

  • ERP got only the clean, customer-facing roles it needed.

  • Sales Cloud kept the internal collaboration intact.

  • The sales team stopped wasting time fixing integration errors.

How It Works

The solution is straightforward: an Internal Flag for party roles in Sales Quotes.

  • Internal roles are not sent to external systems during quote creation and simulation.

  • They also cannot be updated by incoming payloads from ERP.

All you need to do is head to:
User Menu → Settings → All Settings → Sales Quotes → Party Schema,
and check the Internal box for the role you want to keep inside Sales Cloud.

What to Keep in Mind

  • You cannot set the Account party role as internal.

  • The feature is currently in Restricted Release. To activate it, you’ll need to raise an SAP Incident.

 

Wrapping Up

Sometimes, the smallest features bring the biggest relief. The Internal Party Flag gives sales reps the freedom to collaborate with internal roles without worrying about backend clutter.

Customer-facing data stays clean, ERP stays happy, and your sales team gets a smoother quoting experience.

Next time you’re setting up party roles in Sales Cloud, look for that little checkbox; it might just save you a lot of headaches.

entry.title: Discrepancy in TDS Deduction During CN Booking
entry.content:
Hello All,
I hope this message finds you well.
I would like to bring to your attention a discrepancy observed during the booking of a Credit Note (CN) in DHL Express (160086) related to FY 2024-25. The CN was created due to an invoice initially booked with an incorrect GST head.

However, during the CN booking in SAP, TDS was deducted at 2%, whereas, at the time of the original invoice booking, SAP had deducted TDS at 1.35% as per the applicable Lower Deduction Certificate (LDC).

Kindly review this discrepancy and advise on the necessary steps to align the TDS treatment correctly in the system.

Looking forward to your prompt response.

entry.title: SAP FICO Scenario – Vendor Invoice Posting
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

SAP FICO Scenario – Vendor Invoice Posting – FB60 / F-43

Path: Easy Access -> Accounting -> Financial Accounting->Accounts Payable->Document Entry-> FB60 – Invoice/ F-43 - Invoice - General


Scenario Question:
A vendor has supplied raw materials worth ₹1,00,000 plus 18% GST. You need to post this vendor invoice in SAP. How will you handle this transaction in SAP FICO?

Answer (Step-by-Step):
1. Transaction Code:
Use FB60 / F-43 (Vendor Invoice Posting).

2. Entry Details:

Vendor A/c (Credit) – ₹1,18,000 (₹1,00,000 + ₹18,000 GST)

Raw Material Expense/Inventory (Debit) – ₹1,00,000

Input GST A/c (Debit) – ₹18,000

3. Accounting Entry:

Dr Raw Material A/c ₹1,00,000
Dr Input CGST A/c ₹9,000
Dr Input SGST A/c ₹9,000

     Cr Vendor A/c ₹1,18,000

4. Explanation to Interviewer:

Vendor is credited since we owe him money.

Expense/Inventory is debited as we received goods.

GST is debited to claim input tax credit.

Pro Tip to Mention in Interview:
Always highlight how SAP automatically links this entry to the Reconciliation Account for vendors in G/L.

entry.title: Re: I can't complete GR for shipment because the serial n...
entry.content: Material XXXXX has status Restrict-MRP-Block-All in plant xxxx Message no. M7092 Diagnosis In the material master record, the material status (field "MAT/PPC status") has been maintained. This means that use of the material can be restricted.

entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
Hi @ThFiedler ,

Thank you so much for your response.

The alternatives work very well for me. My question is regarding where the ALV category fits within the clean core level framework.

For example, based on the new ATC variant, the use of the REUSE_GRID_DISPLAY function module is flagged as a Priority 2 and categorized as "usage of internal API."

Referring to the Extensibility Guide, this would place the issue under Clean Core Level C, which makes sense.

However, when I looked at the updated version of SAP Note 3578329, it seems that ALV-related components (BC-SRV-ALV) are now categorized under Clean Core Level B.

Am I understanding this correctly, or am I possibly trying to relate two different concepts here?

Thanks again for your support.

Regards,

Kartheek

entry.title: Dynamic MTD/QTD/YTD Calculation in SAC story using Restricted Measure
entry.content:
Introduction

Business users often need to analyze performance not just for the current month, but also on a cumulative basis for the year. Typical requirements include:

  • Month-to-Date (MTD)

  • Year-to-Date (YTD)

In SAC, these comparisons can be achieved with restricted measures and calculated measures, ensuring results update dynamically based on the month selected.

Nomenclature

We’ll use the following shorthand throughout:

  • CY → Current Year

  • PY → Previous Year

  • Cur → Current (Month/Year)

  • Prev → Previous (Month/Year)

Example: Month Selected = Nov 2014

Month-to-Date (MTD)

Measure Definition Example (Nov 2014 selected)
CY Cur MTDCurrent Year Current MTDNov 2014
CY Prev MTDCurrent Year Previous MTDOct 2014
PY Cur MTDPrevious Year Current MTDNov 2013
PY Prev MTDPrevious Year Previous MTDOct 2013

Year-to-Date (YTD)

Measure Definition Example (Nov 2014 selected)
CY Cur YTDCurrent Year Current YTDJan–Nov 2014
CY Prev YTDCurrent Year Previous YTDJan–Oct 2014
PY Cur YTDPrevious Year Current YTDJan–Nov 2013
PY Prev YTDPrevious Year Previous YTDJan–Oct 2013

 

Final Output

When implemented in SAC, the tables update automatically based on the month selection.

For Nov 2014 selected:

Metric

CY Cur

CY Prev

PY Cur

PY Prev

MTD

Nov 2014

Oct 2014

Nov 2013

Oct 2013

YTD

Jan–Nov 2014

Jan–Oct 2014

Jan–Nov 2013

Jan–Oct 2013

We will be using the same nomenclature below.

Start by creating restricted measure on the base measure below.

MTD (Month-to-Date)

CY Cur MTD

CY Prev MTD

PY Cur MTD

PY Prev MTD

 

YTD (Year to date)

CY Cur YTD

CY Prev YTD

PY Cur YTD (Calculated Measure)

PY Prev YTD (Calculated Measure)

Final Output

Based on the Month Selection, the tables update with numbers automatically.

Conclusion

By combining restricted measures and calculated measures in SAC, you can design reports that automatically adjust to user-selected months. This eliminates manual effort and provides instant insights for business users.

References

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/everything-you-need-to-know-about-cumulative-sum-in-sap-analytics-cloud/ba-p/13569357

entry.title: Re: LE-WM is Ending: Understanding Stock Room Management...
entry.content: @ephraimayemere From publicly available sources and SAP’s Note 2881166, Stock Room Management is included under the standard SAP S/4HANA Enterprise Management license. There is no indication that RISE Private must purchase an extra license solely for using Stock Room Management.

entry.title: Re: LE-WM is Ending: Understanding Stock Room Management vs EWM — What’s Next for Your Warehouse in
entry.content: @ephraimayemere From publicly available sources and SAP’s Notes, Stock Room Management is included under the standard SAP S/4HANA Enterprise Management license. There is no indication that RISE Private customers must purchase an extra license solely for using Stock Room Management.

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 Sales Quotation : August Edition
entry.content:
Every month, SAP Sales Cloud keeps evolving with features that make life a little easier for sales reps, managers, and admins. Starting this month, I’ll share a quick roundup of the key innovations for Sales Quotation processes: what they are, why they matter, and how they could impact your day-to-day work.

So let’s dive into the August release highlights.

Products from Past Quotes

Imagine a repeat customer asking for “the same as last time.” Instead of digging through history, you can now pull products directly from past quotes. Search across past quotes using predefined queries: Sales Quotes of Account, All Past Quotes, My Past Quotes, My Past Quotes for Account, Sales Area.

Why it matters: Speed and consistency. No more re-entering items or worrying about missing something from before.

Getting Started

Available by default in the “Add from List” option in the quote product table.

 

Customer Part Numbers & GTIN in Quotes

Every company has its own way of naming products. Customers often don’t care about your internal codes; they want to see their part numbers. Add to that, many industries (retail, pharma, manufacturing) rely on GTINs for standard product identification.

Now, both Customer Part Number and GTIN fields can be used in quotes.

Why it matters: Reduces confusion between internal and customer codes and ensures accuracy in orders

 

Address Change for Parties 

Customers often want changes in delivery, Ship- To or billing addresses.  Sales reps can change the addresses of any account party (e.g. SHIP-TO) to another maintained at the business partner. Works for both account and individual customer parties.

Why it matters:  Reduces costly rework and ensures accuracy in quotes.

Getting Started

Available by default. In card/table views of involved parties, use inline edit to select another address

 

Internal Parties (Restricted Release)

You know how quotes often involve more than just the customer? There are players internal to CRM, such as approvers, pricing specialists, or even sales ops folks. Now, you can mark these roles as internal parties. This keeps things transparent inside your org without cluttering up what gets synced to backend systems like S/4HANA.

Why it matters: cleaner separation of internal vs. external roles, fewer sync headaches, and better accountability.

Getting Started

Go to User Menu → Settings → All Settings → Sales Quotes → Party Schema. Select the Internal checkbox for the role. (Restricted release – raise a SAP Incident to activate.)

You can refer to this detailed blog here - Internal Parties

 

Tables - Sorting and Resizing 

Admins can define which column a sales quote list view is sorted by. Sales users can see which column the list is sorted on.

Column Resize: Users can adjust table column widths in quote lists and product tables.

Getting Started

  • For sorting: Adaptation → Edit section for table → Sort → Select default sort.

  • For resizing: Available by default : just drag column edges to resize.

Other Notable Enhancements

  • Full-Screen View of Activities: Zoom into activities (calls, meetings, tasks) without distractions for better planning.

  • Autoflow: Admins can configure autoflows using array fields of sales quotes.

  • Adaptation: Visual filters in sales quote list views now support flexible adaptation.

  • Search Improvements: Type-ahead search for sales quotes now supports “Related to Account” queries.

  • Org Unit OVS: Sales quotes now support org unit selection within Object Value Selector for extension fields.

Wrapping Up

The August release is a mix of practical usability tweaks and powerful quote enhancements. Together, they remove friction from daily sales work, from avoiding duplicate effort to making sure the right data shows up in the right place.

I’ll be back next time with another round of updates. Till then, which of these features do you see making the biggest impact in your sales process?

entry.title: Re: ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of clean core ABAP development
entry.content:
Hi @Kartheek ,

the note 3578329 describes which technology components belong to which clean core level. But this not mean that all APIs belonging to this component are recommended to use. Each component typically comes with released APIs (Level-A) or classic APIs (Level-B) but also has some internal APIs which are not for use for custom code. Good example is the ALV. The component is rated as Level-B and it comes with a set of classic APIs described in the cloudification repositories. These are the APIs that you should use to work with ALV in a clean core way. The internal APIs can still be used but are not recommended and therefore belong to Clean Core Level-C. There are other components like for example the application Log that also has released APIs that can be used in ABAP Cloud (Level-A). Hope this helps to understand the idea a bit better. 

Regards,

Thomas.

entry.title: Re: CDS view: Which annotations do I need for BW extracti...
entry.content:
Hi,

Should you ignore the warnings? No.

Your approach conflicts with the validator rule.

  • For C2 objects ADT only allows a very small set of annotations (intended for OData Remote APIs). Analytical / data-extraction annotations are not allowed on C2, so ADT shows:

    • ANALYTICS.DATACATEGORY is not allowed

    • ANALYTICS.DATAEXTRACTION.* is not allowed

    • ABAPCATALOG.VIEWENHANCEMENTCATEGORY is not allowed (DDIC-view annotation; not valid for view entities in general)

For BW/4HANA extraction via ODP/ODQ, your CDS is not a Remote API. You should not set C2. Use Local/Not specified (C1 “Released (local)” is fine), and keep the extraction annotations.

Try below options

  1. Revert API state from C2 to C1 (Released – Local) or leave Not specified.

  2. Keep:
    @analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: { enabled: true, delta.changeDataCapture.automatic: true }
    }

  3. Remove DDIC-only annotations such as @AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory (not valid on view entities).

They indicate the wrong API state and an invalid annotation set for a view entity. After switching away from C2 and removing DDIC-only annotations, the warnings will disappear, and the extractor will be valid for BW/4.

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Proce...
entry.content:
Hi Pavan,

To upload a file, the action project cannot be used directly. Instead, the payload must be created through a custom script and submitted via a REST API call in Task Automation.
The process involves the following steps:

  1. Execute a POST request to obtain the access token.

  2. Perform another POST request to upload the document to the designated schema. The response will include the status, ID, and creation date.

  3. Use the returned ID to execute a GET request in order to retrieve the specific document details.

Sample Payload for uploading the document via POST:

let optionsPayload = {
    documentType: "custom",
    schemaName: "delivery_note_schema",
    headerFields: ["deliveryNoteNumber", "purchaseOrderNumber", "deliveryDate"],
    lineItemFields: ["materialNumber", "quantity", "unitOfMeasure"],
    clientId: "default"
};

let requestOptions = {
    method: "POST",
    url: "Your_URL/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs",
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    metadataType: irpa_core.enums.request.metadataType.formData,
    headers: {
        "Authorization": "Bearer " + access_Token
    },
    metadata: [
        {
            name: "file",
            file: fileObj,
            //type: "image/jpeg"
        },
        {
            name: "options",
            value: JSON.stringify(optionsPayload)
        }
    ],
    timeout: 30000
};

return requestOptions;
 
When passing the document in the fileObj parameter, you can use your local file path.
 
I hope this information is helpful!!
 
Thanks,
Aditi Jain

entry.title: Rule-Based Conformance: A Smart Way to Ensure Process Compliance
entry.content:
What Is Rule-Based Conformance?

Rule-based Conformance focuses on checking business rules the atomic units of process knowledge against real execution data. Instead of modeling every possible path in a process, businesses define the rules that matter (for example, “an invoice must always be approved before payment”). These rules are then validated against event logs to quickly identify violations and improvement opportunities.

Which Problem Does It Address?

Companies across industries face challenges such as:

  • Regulatory compliance: Staying compliant while remaining agile is difficult in environments with frequent policy changes.
  • Complex process models: Detailed models are hard to maintain and often become bottlenecks.
  • Operational inefficiencies: Maintaining large process models consumes time, resources, and budget.
  • Slow decision-making: Traditional approaches require long cycles of modeling and simulation before action can be taken

What Are the Benefits?

With Rule-based Conformance, organizations can achieve:

  • Flexible and precise analysis: Focus only on business rules instead of entire models.
  • Reduced operational overhead: Less dependency on large, static models.
  • Enhanced compliance and performance: Quickly detect violations, track critical business behavior, and use insights to improve processes.
  • Actionable recommendations: Receive concrete pointers to mitigate issues and benchmark performance across business units

Step-by-Step: How to Use Rule-Based Conformance

1. Event Log Selection

    • Start by selecting an event log from your SAP Signavio workspace
    • If no log is available, you can import one from SAP Signavio Process Intelligence or use a demo log

 

2. Business Rule Selection

    • Based on your event log, relevant business rules are recommended.
    • Select the rules you want to check against your process data.

 

3. Conformance Report

  • Total Cases (number of executions)
  • Conforming Cases (those without violations)
  • Violations (number and type of rule breaches)

 

 

4. Variant Analysis

    • Explore process variants – unique sequences of activities – to see where violations occur.
    • Violating activities are highlighted in red. Missing activities are displayed separately.
    • You can filter to show only violating variants, making it easy to focus on problem areas.

 

The Solution Explained

At its core, Rule-based Conformance works with event logs and business rules:

  1. Event logs capture actual process execution data from systems.
  2. Business rules (process atoms) define constraints or objectives that must be respected.
  3. The conformance check evaluates each process instance against the selected rules.
  4. A conformance report highlights where processes meet expectations and where violations occur.
  5. Variant analysis visualizes how violations appear across different execution patterns, helping teams pinpoint root causes.

 

!Try It Yourself!

Rule-based Conformance is currently available as a test version in the SAP Signavio Lab Space. This means every SAP Signavio customer can try it out and explore its potential hands-on before it becomes generally available. It’s a unique opportunity to experiment with rule-based compliance checks and provide feedback that will shape the future of process improvement.

Here you find the guidelines to activate an app in the SAP Signavio Lab Space

Conclusion

Rule-based Conformance empowers businesses to simplify compliance checks, reduce overhead, and accelerate decision-making. By focusing on business rules instead of rigid models, organizations gain agility while maintaining full control over compliance and performance.

This is not just about conformance it’s about making process improvement more actionable, scalable, and intelligent.

entry.title: Batch Split Valuation in Product Cost Controlling and Margin Analysis
entry.content:
Introduction

This blog will illustrate how Cloud ERP standard features and scope items can handle customer’s product profitability reporting requirements based on product batches. Product cost controlling aspect of split valuation will be our focus and specifically, below scope items are relevant for the blog:

  • Event-Based Production Cost Posting(3F0)
  • Actual costing (33Q)
  • Margin Analysis (J55)

Business requirements

The customer would like to view profitability based on a specific product batch. The revenue for the product is the same cross batches, but the costs may vary for different batches. From management accounting point of view, the “cost objects” here is the combination of products and their batches.

 

Meeting the requirements

SAP Cloud ERP standard features can handle such business requirements. Split valuation based on batches needs to be activated( please refer to blog Split Valuation in Inventory Management on SAP S/4... - SAP Community and its references for more details about split valuation).

With the support of batch split valuation in production accounting (please refer to Split Valuation - Production Scenarios - Product Cost by Order - Production Accounting) Production variances can be posted to the product batches upon goods receipt from the manufacturing orders.

Let’s demonstrate the processes  with some testing screenshots.

Here, two production orders are created and upon goods receipts, production variances are settled. 

Variances with different categories (SLA Line-Item types) are posted to EO Profitability Segment with Inventory Valuation Type attribute. (only one production order is shown in the screenshots)

Next, two sales orders are created for the same product with plans on delivering two different batches (Inventory Valuation Types) respectively.

With delivery orders created based on the sales orders, post goods issues are performed based on product batches. Here, in the accounting document, the cost of goods sold is with Inventory Valuation Type filled (only one sales order process is shown in the screenshots)

Afterwards, with billing performed, revenue is posted with the product batch as additional dimension.

In Trial Balance app, the profitability can be seen for the product and inventory valuation types, albeit the costs of goods sold at this stage are based on standard costs and they are the same for both valuation types. (Alternatively, other Fiori apps can also be used such as Sales Orders - Actuals, Market Segments – Actuals, Product Profitability with Production Variances if the Inventory Valuation Type field is enabled through Data Source Extensions)

During period end, the actual costing run process  will distribute variances proportionally among inventory, work in process, and consumption with the granularity of valuation types and materials. As can be seen, valuation type is available in Material Price Analysis, therefore the “cost object” here is the combination of material and valuation type(batch) and they have different actual prices.

s

(Thanks to @GraceZou  for doing the testing for this part and please refer to her blog Actual Costing in SAP Cloud ERP - SAP Community for Actual Costing business processes)

The previous posted costs of goods sold for the batches(Inventory Valuation Type) will get revaluated to reflect the actual costs for the batches. Together with posted revenues, the profitabilities for the product batches can be arrived at.

From margin analysis side, Inventory Valuation Type will be available in Product Profitability Review Booklet In the upcoming release.

Summary

This blog omits split valuation master data set-up, production planning, sales and distribution aspect of process and screenshots, rather, it focuses on Inventory Valuation Type on accounting documents for the business processes with regards to production accounting, actual costing settlement and revaluation, and profitability reports.

Feel free to leave comments or post questions and explore other content and blogs in the community.

entry.title: Re: How to speed up depreciation for an asset's rest life
entry.content:
Hello @Dylan2 

Thank you for your question.

The Depreciation Key & Asset Master Data references will provide details.

However, to summarise, in public cloud your requirement is supported through the intervals in the asset master. The issued about depreciation you described comes from how the interval and the useful life settings are interpreted.

The reason that happens is because when you create a new interval and set the useful life to a range of 5 periods, the system then interprets it as the entire remaining net book value must be depreciated across the new life starting at the new interval start date. So, if the start date of the new interval does not align with the next depreciation period or if the remaining life is misaligned with the Depreciation Key logic e.g., pro rata to zero, the system may try to post everything in the first period instead of spreading it across.

The recommended best practice is to:

  • Keep your historical interval and not adjust or overwrite them in this process
  • It is best you create a new interval starting from the next posting date
  • Adjust useful life correctly by entering the number of remaining periods you want the asset to depreciate over instead of 5 periods.
  • Ensure you set your depreciation key correctly to distribute over remaining life by ensuring the useful life is set in a way that interval starts in the right period. This will spread it over 5 months.
  • Finally, you can verify your data by using the simulate change function which then displays depreciation calculation. If the system still takes all in one month, check if the remaining useful life is calculated correctly in your new interval. Sometimes you need to leave years blank and only set period 5

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Change contact info for S user S00xxxxxxxx

To update the phone number associated with your S-user ID, any Super, Cloud, or User Administrator within your organization can make this change. You can locate the list of Administrators by navigating to the "Users & Contacts - SAP for Me" section in SAP for Me. 

For additional guidance, please refer to KBA 1271545 - How to update SAP for Me and S-user ID settings (phone number, e-mail address, time zone, language, etc) - SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI for Windows 8.10 Beta Program – Call for participation
entry.content: @LAIENPING Regarding your question for adding parameters to the installation to cover additional options from SAP GUI options dialog: We have discussed this internally and came to the conclusion that we cannot add all the parameters to the installation as this would be a lot of effort and come with constant effort to keep this updated. The idea of adding these parameters in the UI was to slightly improve the ease of use for the most important parameters. And then you do not have to run any manual tasks per user anyway already today. See the SAP GUI Installation Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/sap_gui_for_windows/1ebe3120fd734f67afc57b979c3e2d46/b3602f866c204fa68aa2da460011e342.html for information how to add content to an installation package. You can add the registry values to your installation packages and NWSAPSetup will do the rest.

entry.title: Cost price difference (PRD) in transaction MIGO for V-Price material
entry.content:

we use a material that is valuated at moving average price. For this material, we want to post a goods receipt with movement type 101 in period 08/2025 in transaction MIGO. SAP gives us error No. M8147 “Account determination for entry OPWE PRD 0001 ___ 3061 not possible”.

We expected SAP to adjust the moving average price. Why does SAP want to post price differences?

Thanks for your support.

Best regards, Marcel Schumacher

entry.title: Automatic Sales Order Creation in SAP S/4HANA from SAP CPQ Quote 2.0 via iFlow
entry.content:
HiHi,

I would like to inquire about the integration capabilities between SAP CPQ and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

After creating a quote in SAP CPQ (Quote 2.0), is there a standard functionality or integration flow available that allows the quote to automatically generate a Sales Order in SAP S/4HANA?

Specifically, we are looking for a way to automate the creation of Sales Orders in S/4HANA without manual intervention once the quote is finalized in CPQ.

Additionally, we would like to confirm whether the standard iFlow "Replicate Quote 2.0 from SAP CPQ to SAP S/4HANA Sales Order" supports this automatic Sales Order creation process. If so, could you please provide documentation or configuration guidance?

https://api.sap.com/integrationflow/Replicate_Quote_2.0_from_SAP_CPQ_to_SAP_S4HANA_Sales_Order

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: SAP Security Forum
entry.content:
Increasing regulatory requirements and the need to secure business-critical SaaS platforms continue to present new challenges for IT security teams. Key topics that companies will need to address in the future regarding SAP security include various aspects of IT cybersecurity. ​

This year’s SAP Security Forum offers practical presentations and interactive sessions that will cover current issues such as infrastructure and communication security, identity and access management, and compliance. ​

​

DSAG Members save 10%. Use the code DSAG_DISC_25 to get 10% off your event ticket. ​

Registration link: WDESEC - SAP Security Forum | SAP Training

 

Conference Language: German

entry.title: Re: In S/4HANA Public Cloud, what is the cds view that co...
entry.content:
Hello @Joey3 

Thank you for your question,

Within the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the cost element category is obtained from the G/L account master through the released CDS views I_GLAccountInChartOfAccounts and I_GLAccountInCompanyCode. As the on-premises FM K_ACCOUNT_ASSIGNMENT_GET is not available in the Cloud. You can refer to this SAP Useful documentation, SAP Help-Released CDS Views – Finance

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to speed up depreciation for an asset's rest life
entry.content: Hi Chris, you really explain it very nice, thank you so much. I think the reason was my depreciation key, I used LINS to run depreciation, but it seems LINS is by year, not month. Then I found if I want the depreciation goes to next 5 months(across year), I need to set a longer useful life like 1 year and 5 periods， then it will not go to only one month.

entry.title: Re: Number Range Buffer - Why We Sometimes See Skips in The Number Range for Business Partners
entry.content:
Hi @Stephen_Ward ,

Thank you for sharing this valuable information. I do have one query—within SAP Public Cloud, does the Business Partner Number Range have any impact on Business Users? I am asking because CB Users also seem to be affected when there are skipped number ranges.

For explanation purposes I've added an example.

1st User with CB ID -> CB9980000001

2nd User with CB ID -> CB9980000002

. . . . 

10th User with CB ID -> CB9980000010

But then on the next time when creating the users (not in the same session or day) it starts the series from CB9980000040.

 

I would appreciate your insights on this.

Thanks & Regards,
Jaimin Jani

entry.title: SAP Data and Analytics Forum
entry.content:
The SAP Data and Analytics Forum offers an overview of the latest developments and trends in SAP Data & Analytics. ​

​

On the first day, which is free of charge, the focus will be on presenting the latest trends and developments in Data and Analytics. Participants will gain insights into best practices, new technologies, and applications related to the SAP Business Data Cloud.​

​

The second day, which requires a participation fee, provides the opportunity to deepen expertise through expert sessions and engage in discussions with SAP specialists, trainers, and other participants.​

​

Participants of the 2-day forum will receive a 25% discount on their next certification.​

​

​

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, November 18, 2025 (free virtual first day)​

WDVDAF - SAP Data und Analytics Forum (virtuell) | SAP Training​

​

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, November 18-19, 2025 (2 days, hybrid delivery, the second day is subject to a fee)​

WDCDAF - SAP Data und Analytics Forum (hybrid) | SAP Training​

​

DSAG Members can use the code DSAG_DISC_25 to get 10% off their event ticket. ​

​

Conference Language: German

entry.title: SAP Integration Suite Forum
entry.content:
SAP Integration Suite is an integration platform-as-a-service (iPaaS) that enables the integration of on-premise and cloud-based processes, services, applications, events, and data.​

​

The SAP System Integration Suite Forum provides an opportunity to explore the key features, practical use cases, and benefits of the SAP Systems Integration Suite. Participants can learn about the seamless integration of on-premise and cloud applications and processes using tools and preconfigured content managed by SAP.​

 ​

Registration link: WDSISD - SAP Integration Suite Forum | SAP Training​

​

DSAG Members can use the code DSAG_DISC_25 to get 10% off their event ticket. ​

​

Conference Language: German

entry.title: Running GK660 Error Running COI Post EC-CS Migration
entry.content:
We are migrating from EC-CS to Group Reporting 2023 private cloud.
System was migrated from EC-CS to GR – we are in process of migration and now testing.

When running the COI, I receive the error COI: Item clearing of consolidation of investments has not been maintained GK660.
1 Any ideas how to resolve?
We would like to configure for rule based consolidation of investments (COI). COI config was not in place during the EC-CS timeframe.

As this is a migration, there is no best practices, therefore I added the investment equity and minority interest attributes, task/method and 11 rules for Investment, equity and Minority interest calculation. There is no config for goodwill. Purchase method only, no equity method. Doc Type 30 configured for COI – left the same from EC-CS (again was never in use).

2. Given the basic COI requirements/config is there a need to complete the COI configuration section?
It’s mostly related to goodwill and equity method – Does it have to be fully configured?

3. I added minimal COI config (methods task doc type) and receive COI consistency check errors:
* Appropriations for goodwill has not been maintained
* Currency translation for goodwill has not been maintained
* Net Income for partial divestures has not been maintained
How do I resolve?
Thanks in advance.
Eyal

entry.title: Re: Request for Actual Cost Report on Existing WBS Elements
entry.content:
Hello @SudeCeper 

Try reviewing these references for more detail.

Analytical Apps for Plan/Actual Analysis,  Project Progress Reporting,  Commercial View ,  Project History PS PUBLIC CLOUD

Custom Analytical Queries

To summarise, the classic on-premise report is not available in public cloud. This is because traditional GUI transaction codes have been replaced with the Fiori apps and CDS-based analytical reports.

In public cloud you can do the following in regards to your use case:

  • Generate project actuals and financial reports through the Project actuals Fiori app.
  • You can display the commercial view of your project reports, measuring your plan vs. actuals using the app.
  • You can display actual line items by drilling down to individual postings at WBS level.
  • You can generate aggregated and detailed project cost report at WBS level.
  • Finally, you can create your own custom analytical query on top of released CDS views.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: onClick() event in SAc Scripting,
entry.content:
Please try the below. 

// Clear previous chart data

Chart_1.removeDimensions();
Chart_1.removeMeasures();

Chart_1.addDimension("account", Feed.CategoryAxis);

// Optional: filter the dimension to a specific member
// Uncomment the next line if you want to show only "Revenue"
// Chart_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("account", ["Revenue"]);

// Add the measure to Y-axis
Chart_1.addMeasure("net_sales", Feed.ValueAxis);

// Refresh the chart to apply changes
Chart_1.update();

entry.title: Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel 1.1.2026 (WDEHR4)
entry.content:
Gesetzliche Änderungen und die Auswirkungen auf die Lohn- und Gehaltsabrechnung ab dem 1. Januar 2026​

​

Auch für das kommende Jahr stehen Reformen, gesetzliche Änderungen und Neuregelungen an, die es in der Personalabrechnung zu beachten gilt. Unsere Sonderveranstaltung bietet einen Überblick über die neuen Funktionalitäten sowie Informationen zu deren Customizing.​

​

Die Veranstaltung richtet sich an Mitglieder von Projektteams, Mitarbeiter sowie erfahrene Berater aus dem Bereich Personalabrechnung.​

​

​

Registrierungslink: WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel 1.1.2026 | SAP Training​
​

​

Veranstaltungssprache: Deutsch

entry.title: Re: Market Segment Planning using Extension fields with B...
entry.content:
Dear ALL,

I found that the Extension field using "Business Context Accounting: Market Segment" must end with the suffix _MSE, as shown in the example below.

YY1_newfield_MSE

Thank you

Su Young.

entry.title: Re: Verification of Payee (VoP) - What is planned in SAP S/4HANA Cloud ERP
entry.content:
@Albus Hi, 

there was not yet any enhancement for situations. 

There is a situation template for time outs available (template FIN_BCM_TIMEOUT), which could be used. Via this template a user can be informed, if a batch status has not been changed for a certain time. 

Best regards, Andrea

entry.title: How build story report for cascading goals
entry.content: Currently, we see only goal ID of cascading goal in the query. We are looking the way to report about more complex data for example, few columns about goal (like name, status, employee display name, employee title) and then the same info about cascaded goal (cascaded goal name, cascaded goal status, cascaded employee display name)
